image.altText: A close up of Lauren Willgoose with a serious expression on her face

props.synopsis: An Adelaide lawyer who drank 1.15 litres of wine before crashing into prominent neuropsychologist Anthony Walsh has been found guilty.

title.children: Lawyer who drank 1.15L of wine before fatal crash found guilty

image.altText: A walkway in the St Kilda Mangrove Trail.

props.synopsis: A salt mining company has paid $100,000 as part of a civil settlement following the dieback of hectares of mangrove forest in Adelaide's north.

title.children: EPA reaches $100k settlement with salt mining company over mangrove forest dieback

image.altText: A man holding 100 dollar bills in his hand

props.synopsis: The property investor and social media influencer regularly holds cash and prize giveaways on his social media to subscribed members of his rewards club.

title.children: Melbourne businessman Adrian Portelli to face a South Australian court over unlawful lottery charges

image.altText: 10 large SUVs, packed with camping gear, drive down a sandhill.

props.synopsis: Environment authorities say helicopter fly-overs are needed at South Australia's popular beaches but four-wheel drivers have questioned whether it is an over-reaction.

title.children: National park rangers use helicopter to catch 4WD vehicles breaking rules

image.altText: Jed Altschwager and Nikki Ayers display their gold medals after winning gold at the 2024 Paris Paralympic Games.

props.synopsis: Australian para-rower Jed Altschwager hangs up the oars, three months after making history by winning gold at the Paris Paralympic Games.

title.children: Aussie Paralympic great retires after decorated para-rowing career

image.altText: A teenage girl carving along a river on a waterski.

props.synopsis: Eira Dalzell has been selected to represent Australia at the World Disabled Water Ski Championships three years after losing some of her fingers in a boating accident.

title.children: Teenage waterskier to represent Australia three years after serious boating accident

image.altText: Tjulapi Alison Carroll holding a microphone while sitting in a row of people

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Indigenous doctors have converged from across the globe to share their tips for good health.

title.children: Indigenous doctors from across the globe point to the benefits of first languages in health

image.altText: Woman three children sitting reading a book, all hugging on lawns with ocean and ship in background

props.synopsis: Wirangu teen Mia Speed say she treasures the difference her book is making to empower and inspire her younger family members.

title.children: Teen's dream to inspire her nephews and nieces with language book reconnects a community to its culture

image.altText: India cricketer Virat Kohli runs off the Adelaide Oval in front of fans at training before the second Test against Australia.

props.synopsis: Indian team management wants fans to be kept away from the Test team's training sessions to cut down on distractions, according to Cricket Australia.

title.children: India bans fans from training sessions for Border Gavaskar Test series

image.altText: Bank notes wrapped together on a table.

props.synopsis: An international investigation exposes an alleged Russian billion-dollar money laundering network whose reach is said to have spanned more than 30 countries.

title.children: An alleged billion-dollar Russian money laundering network spanning more than 30 countries has been exposed

image.altText: Exterior of Newcastle court.

props.synopsis: A man accused of the chronic abuse of his daughter with multiple personalities has been found guilty of raping her and a sibling over several years.

title.children: Father found guilty of sexual abuse of daughter with multiple personalities

image.altText: Raina Cruise wearing sunglasses outdoors

props.synopsis: Raina Cruise has been given a good behaviour bond for assaulting a police officer and two security guards while "particularly fired-up" after attending an anti-COVID vaccination rally in 2021.

title.children: Failed senate candidate avoids immediate jail for assaulting police officer, security guards

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: The ramping crisis which first emerged in Adelaide 15 years ago is "not about people coming in with a cut finger" but a global issue requiring broader solutions than bigger hospitals, an inquest into the deaths of three people has heard.

title.children: 'I can't breathe': Inquest into ramping reveals extent of crisis in South Australia with 'no simple solution'

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt standing in a gym.

props.synopsis: Clifford Neumann will spend more than 20 years in jail after planning and carrying out the murder of mother-of-five Victoria Stewart.

title.children: Clifford Neumann sentenced to 20 years in jail for murdering Victoria Stewart

image.altText: composite image featuring chappell roan, overmono and something for kate

props.synopsis: On Spotify Wrapped day, we share the music we loved. But sometimes the data just doesn't seem to match up with our expectations.

title.children: The weirdest things in our Spotify Wrapped this year

image.altText: A North Korean woman in her 30s helps a North Korean man in his 30 sign a document

props.synopsis: News of an unfolding political crisis in South Korea dominated global headlines. But just over the border, North Koreans are kept in the dark. How will the hermit kingdom's leaders respond?

title.children: Why has North Korea stayed silent about South Korea's political crisis?

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's defence secretary nominee says he's the victim of a media smear campaign, and he'll "fight like hell" for the job — despite reports the president-elect is already considering replacing him with his one-time Republican rival.

title.children: Trump's Pentagon pick says he'll 'fight like hell' for the job in face of 'smear' campaign

image.altText: Glass on ground with Maryborough town sign in background

props.synopsis: The now-14-year-old pleaded guilty to causing a multi-vehicle crash that killed two women and a teenage girl on Queensland's Fraser Coast.

title.children: Teenage boy sentenced to youth detention for triple-fatal stolen car crash

image.altText: Phoebe Litchfield of Australia plays a cut shot

props.synopsis: Australia will chase 101 for victory against India, as the three-match ODI series gets underway at Brisbane's Allan Border Field. Follow live.

title.children: Aussies on track but quick wickets makes 101 a tricky total to chase

image.altText: A woman holds her phone in her hand, she is sat in front of several small us flags

props.synopsis: A large number of Americans' data has been stolen in a telecoms attack allegedly carried out by a Chinese hacking group dubbed "Salt Typhoon," and according to one senator, the extent and depth of the hack is "absolutely mind-boggling".

title.children: 'Terrifying' Chinese hacking campaign sees large numbers of Americans' data stolen, US officials say

image.altText: a selfie of a mum and sun smiling while on holidays in America

props.synopsis: A chance encounter at a Robina pub led to the 26-year-old Dylan McPadden's alleged murder in 2023. Tyler Hailes and his partner Jade Laing have been committed to stand trial.

title.children: Gold Coast couple ordered to stand trial over alleged murder of 26-year-old man at a pub

image.altText: A man inside a building looking out to a pile of bricks from a destroyed house.

props.synopsis: A new 300-page report alleges Israel has and continues to undertake acts of genocide against Palestinian people in Gaza.

title.children: Israel undertaking genocide against Palestinians in Gaza, Amnesty International claims

image.altText: A CCTV image of a man holding up a gun on the footpath in Manhattan, wearing a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Brian Thompson, the chief executive of UnitedHealthcare, was on his way to a corporate meeting when he was attacked.

title.children: Manhunt underway in New York after CEO of largest US health insurer shot dead

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: The former teacher was found guilty of unlawful sexual activity with a girl aged between 10 and 17, which related to his time as a teacher in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson launches appeal over unlawful sexual activity with a student conviction

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Redflow CEO Tim Harris.

props.synopsis: Redflow had political backing and a soaring ambition to sell energy storage to the world, but its $10,000 batteries regularly failed within months of installation leaving customers out of pocket.

title.children: Redflow was the great hope of Australian manufacturing. Its collapse left customers with broken batteries

image.altText: A French man with glasses and gray hair sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: The vote has ousted Prime Minister Michel Barnier and his government, meaning President Emmanuel Macron will have to pick a viable successor with over two years of his presidential term left.

title.children: French government toppled by no-confidence motion in blow to President Emmanuel Macron

image.altText: A woman with dark hair a black jacket and a pink shirt speaks at a conference

props.synopsis: Global mining giants are urging the federal government to push ahead with a promised overhaul of environmental laws, after the prime minister shut down Senate negotiations.

title.children: BHP boss warns bad environmental laws will hurt Australia's ability to seize 'greatest industrial shift in history'

image.altText: A small black ball on a beach

props.synopsis: A small number of balls appeared on the eastern end of Silver Beach in Kurnell on Thursday morning, with the Environmental Protection Authority investigating and Sutherland Shire Council cleaning up the affected area.

title.children: Mysterious balls wash up on Sydney beach as council begins clean-up

image.altText: Composite picture of Angus Taylor, Michele Bullock and Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: Australia's latest national accounts show why we probably would have had to be in recession to have seen an interest rate cut this year.

title.children: What spending would you cut in a 'sad economy without much hope'?

image.altText: Dash smiles in a crowd at a music festival, the stage behind her.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are taking the opioid reversal drug naloxone with them on nights out. We've unpacked what it is and how it works, and busted some myths along the way.

title.children: 'Everyone was freaking out, screaming': Naloxone nasal spray may save lives

image.altText: A close-up of hand scrolling through the news on a phone

props.synopsis: A new report by a UK research team finds adults who are more gullible struggle to tell the difference between real and fake news.

title.children: Mistrustful adults could be more vulnerable to conspiracy theories and bad at spotting fake news, report finds

image.altText: A series of white pads stitched with colourful patterns.

props.synopsis: A controversy over sanitary pads in China has sparked widespread outrage on social media and ignited a broader debate on gender inequality.

title.children: Sanitary pad sizes in China ignite debate about women's rights

image.altText: Four Albatross birds standing around with a female named Wisdom looking at her egg

props.synopsis: Wisdom the Laysan albatross lays another egg this year at the Midway Atoll National Wildlife Refuge in Hawaii with a new mating partner.

title.children: World's oldest known wild bird, an albatross named Wisdom, lays egg at 74

image.altText: A court sketch of a woman with dark skin in a suit wearing handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Australian woman Donna Nelson has been found guilty of trafficking drugs into Japan. Here is how the two-year saga unfolded and what happens next.

title.children: Japanese court finds Donna Nelson guilty, but also a victim

image.altText: Mike Baird speaking at a media conference at Adelaide Oval.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia defends its position on refusing to play Afghanistan in a bilateral series after outgoing ICC chair Greg Barclay offers a parting shot at the organisation.

title.children: Cricket Australia boss 'proud' of Afghanistan stance after ICC criticism
